conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a psychiatry movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: What a fascinating selection! I think you might really enjoy "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest" (1975). This classic film is a powerful exploration of the human psyche, featuring an iconic performance from Jack Nicholson as R.P. McMurphy, who shakes things up at a mental institution. With its timely and thought-provoking themes, I think you'll find it a compelling watch.

conversation.speaker: USER

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: I think I've got just the right fit for you! Based on your interest in psychiatry, I highly recommend "Lady in the Water" (2006). This unique and captivating film explores themes of perception, reality, and the human condition through the eyes of an apartment building superintendent who rescues a mysterious young woman from his pool. With a talented cast, including Jared Harris and Bryce Dallas Howard, this movie will keep you engaged and curious until the very end!

I think I've got just the right fit for you!

If you're in the mood for something a bit unconventional and thought-provoking, I'd recommend "Passion" (2011). It's not your typical film, but it explores some interesting themes around identity and self-acceptance through the lens of competitive beard growing. Who knew that could be so fascinating?

Alternatively, if you're open to something a bit more light-hearted and fun, "Shark Tale" (2004) might be up your alley! It's an animated comedy with a great voice cast, including Angelina Jolie and Jack Black. The plot is playful and entertaining, and it's a great way to pass the time.

Let me know if you'd like more recommendations or have any questions about these films!
